intro: Lobanilia ovalis, commonly known as the oval spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically oval in shape. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Lobanilia ovalis is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
